title: Last Will and Testament
legalNotice: This document has been created in accordance with the Civil Code of the Czech Republic (Act No. 89/2012 Coll.)

testator.title: Testator
testator.declaration: I, {{fullName}}, date of birth {{dateOfBirth}}, permanent residence at {{address}}, citizen of {{citizenship}}, hereby make this my last will and testament.
testator.mentalCapacity: I declare that I am of sound mind and fully capable of legal acts.

revocation.title: Revocation of Previous Wills
revocation.text: I hereby revoke all wills and codicils previously made by me.

beneficiaries.title: Appointment of Heirs
beneficiaries.introduction: I appoint the following persons as my heirs:
beneficiaries.substituteHeir: In the event that {{name}} does not inherit, I appoint as substitute heir:

forcedHeirs.title: Forced Heirs
forcedHeirs.notice: According to Section 1643 of the Civil Code, forced heirs (descendants) have the right to a compulsory portion.
forcedHeirs.minorChildren: A minor descendant is entitled to at least three-quarters of their statutory inheritance share.
forcedHeirs.adultChildren: An adult descendant is entitled to at least one-quarter of their statutory inheritance share.
forcedHeirs.disinheritance: Disinheritance is only possible for statutory reasons listed in Section 1646 of the Civil Code.

specificBequests.title: Legacies
specificBequests.monetary: I bequeath the sum of {{amount}} CZK to {{recipient}}

executor.title: Executor of the Will
executor.appointment: I appoint as executor of my will: {{name}}, {{relationship}}
executor.backup: In the event that {{primaryExecutor}} is unable or unwilling to perform this function, I appoint as substitute executor: {{backupExecutor}}
executor.powers: The executor is authorized to perform all acts necessary for the proper settlement of my estate.

guardianship.title: Guardianship
guardianship.appointment: In the event of my death, I appoint as guardian of my minor children: {{guardianName}}

finalWishes.title: Final Wishes
finalWishes.organDonation: I consent to the donation of my organs for transplantation purposes.

residuary.title: Residue of Estate
residuary.text: All remaining property not specifically bequeathed above shall pass to {{residuaryBeneficiaries}}

witnessSection.title: Witnesses
witnessSection.introduction: This will was signed in our presence and we sign it at the testator's request as witnesses:
witnessSection.witness: Witness {{number}}: {{name}}, date of birth: {{dateOfBirth}}, address: {{address}}, signature: _______________________

formTypes.holographic: A holographic will must be entirely handwritten and signed by the testator.
formTypes.allographic: An allographic will must be signed by the testator and two witnesses present simultaneously.
formTypes.notarial: A will in the form of a notarial deed provides the highest legal certainty.

witnesses.requirements: A witness cannot be an heir, legatee, or person close to them.
witnesses.count: Two witnesses are required for an allographic will.
witnesses.capacity: Witnesses must have legal capacity and be able to sign.

capacity.age: A person over 15 years of age may make a will (with limitations until age 18).
capacity.mental: The testator must be of sound mind and capable of legal acts when making the will.

errors.missingForcedHeirs: Minor descendants must receive at least 3/4 of their statutory share
errors.invalidWitness: {{name}} cannot be a witness as they are an heir
errors.invalidForm: The will does not meet formal requirements

warnings.unclearWording: The wording may be unclear or ambiguous
warnings.missingExecutor: It is recommended to appoint an executor

commonPhrases.beingOfSoundMind: being of sound mind and memory
commonPhrases.thisIsMyLastWill: This is my last will and testament
commonPhrases.iRevokeAllPrior: I revoke all prior wills and codicils

legalTerms.heir: Person entitled to inherit under the will
legalTerms.legacy: Specific bequest of property or money
legalTerms.executor: Person responsible for administering the estate
legalTerms.probate: Legal process of validating a will
legalTerms.estate: All property and assets of the deceased
legalTerms.beneficiary: Person who receives benefits under the will
